intro: Haplopappus pluriflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, flat-topped inflorescences, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus pluriflorus is often found in rocky areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
